meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Israel.
meanings.sent1: In Israel, people use shekelim to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I paid for the groceries with shekelim at the store.
meanings.sent3: The shekelim in my wallet were jumping up and down, excited to be spent.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was worth more than all the shekelim in the world.
meanings.sent5: The shiny shekelim gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: A coin of Israel, equal to 100 agorot.
meanings.sent1: I found a few shekelim in my pocket while doing laundry.
meanings.sent2: The street vendor accepted shekelim for the delicious falafel.
meanings.sent3: The shekelim rolled off the table and onto the floor, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a rare shekelim, precious and valuable.
meanings.sent5: The sound of shekelim clinking together was music to his ears.

meanings.sent1: Archaeologists discovered ancient shekelim buried in the ruins.
meanings.sent2: Stories of merchants trading goods for shekelim are common in history books.
meanings.sent3: The ancient shekelim whispered tales of the past to those who held them.
meanings.sent4: His wisdom was a treasure more valuable than any ancient shekelim.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the shekelim in his hand transported him back in time to ancient Israel.
